edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf

Class ShortestPath

  • Object
    • ShortestPath

  • public class ShortestPath
extends Object
    The ShortestPath class calculates and stores the length of shortest paths between any two nodes of a molecular graph. The implementation is based on the Floyd-Warshall algorithm. One instance of ShortestPath can be reused to compute distances for several chemical graphs, this serves the more efficient storage space usage. Internal structures are grown dynamically when a molecular structure larger than any previous one is given as input for the shortest path calculation. (Author: Miklos Vargyas, ChemAxon)

    Example of typical usage: 

     ShortestPath sp();   
 ...
 MoleculeGraph mg = get the first molecular graph
 while ( ...  there are more molecular graphs ... ) {
   sp.calculate( mg );
   for ( int i = 1; i < mg.getAtomCount(); ++i ) {
     for ( int j = 0; j < i; ++j ) {
       System.out.println( "The length of the shortest path between nodes " +
                           i + " and " + j " is " sp.minDist( i, j ) );
     }
   }
   mg = get next molecular graph
 }
    In its current implementation the edges of the graph are unweighted (that is all weights are equal to 1). This can easily be changed if needed later.
    NOTE: This code, downloaded from the ChemAxon forum, has been slightly revised to comply with the newer JChem 5.4.0 API. CGraph has been replaced by MoleculeGraph. However, although MoleculeGraph.getBondTable() is recommended, this chemaxon.util.BondTable is not documented and it is not clear how to access the values, so MoleculeGraph.getBtab() is still used.
    (Jeremy Yang, 25 Feb 2011)
    Since:
    JChem 2.0.0
    Author:
    Miklos Vargyas

      • calculate

        public void calculate(MoleculeGraph mg)
        Calculates all minimum path lengths and stores them.
        Parameters:
        mg - The chemical graph in which shortest paths have to be determined.

      • minDist

        public int minDist(int a,
          int b)
        Gets the length of the shortest path between two nodes of the graph.
        Parameters:
        a - index of the first node
        b - index of the second node
        Returns:
        The minimum distance (the length of the shortest path) between the two given nodes.

      • getPath

        public int getPath(int a,
          int b,
          int[] nodes)
        Gets all nodes on the path between the two givennodes.
        Parameters:
        a - starting node
        b - end node
        nodes - output parameter, node indices on the path from a to b It is the callers responsibility to provide a sufficiently large array.
        Returns:
        path length, number of node indices stored in nodes[]
